english: Doctrine of the Mean; middle way

etymology.description: 中庸 + 之道 = the way/principle of moderation (the Mean).
etymology.interpretation: Confucian principle of avoiding extremes and acting with balanced appropriateness according to context. Emphasizes harmony and proportion rather than bland compromise.

parts.english: moderation; the mean; due measure; mediocrity
the way of; doctrine of; method of; principle of

examples.chinese: 在处理冲突时，要遵循中庸之道(在處理衝突時，要遵循中庸之道)。
examples.pinyin: Zài chǔlǐ chōngtū shí, yào zūnxún zhōngyōng zhī dào.
examples.english: When handling conflicts, one should follow the Doctrine of the Mean.

examples.chinese: 他主张在经济政策上走中庸之道(他主張在經濟政策上走中庸之道)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǔzhāng zài jīngjì zhèngcè shàng zǒu zhōngyōng zhī dào.
examples.english: He advocates taking a middle way in economic policy.

examples.chinese: 中庸之道并非妥协，而是把握分寸与时机(中庸之道並非妥協，而是把握分寸與時機)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyōng zhī dào bìngfēi tuǒxié, ér shì bǎwò fēncùn yǔ shíjī.
examples.english: The Doctrine of the Mean is not compromise but grasping proportion and timing.
